name.title: Service name
name.description: The name of this DC/OS DSE instance

service_secret_name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed

service_account.description: The principal for the service instance

user.description: The user that runs the Cassandra nodes and owns the Mesos sandbox

mesos_api_version.description: Configures the Mesos API version to use. Possible values: V0 (non-HTTP), V1 (HTTP)

log_level.description: The log level for the DC/OS service

region.description: All DSE nodes will run in this region.  When no region is specified the nodes are constrained to the local region

custom_domain.description: A custom domain to be used in place of autoip.dcos.thisdcos.directory. This can be used to expose the service securely outside of the cluster, but requires setting up external DNS. See the service documentation for details

readiness_check.description: Readiness check settings. Excercise caution when modifying these default values as it can lead to spurious task failures

interval.description: The period in seconds to wait after the last readiness check has completed to start the next check

delay.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait before starting the readiness check attempts

timeout.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait for a readiness check to succeed

check.description: Health check used to determine the scheduler health based on the status of the scheduler plans

intervalSeconds.description: The period in seconds to wait after the last check has completed to start the next check

timeoutSeconds.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait for check to succeed

delaySeconds.description: An amount of time in seconds to wait before starting the check attempts

external_seeds.title: External seed nodes
external_seeds.description: Comma-separated list of seed hosts for multi-DC operation

count.title: Node count
count.description: Number of DSE nodes in the cluster

virtual_network.description: Name of virtual network for dse node(s) to join

cni_plugin_labels.description: Labels to pass to CNI plugin. Comma-seperated key:value pairs. For example [k_0:v_0,k_1:v_1,...,k_n:v_n]

data_volume_profile.description: Volume profile to be used for storing DSE Node data

install_disk_type.title: Persistent DSE installation volume type
install_disk_type.description: Specify Persistent DSE installation volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]

install_volume_profile.description: Volume profile to be used for storing DSE Node installation

log_disk_type.title: Persistent log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]
log_disk_type.description: Specify Persistent log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]

log_volume_profile.description: Volume profile to be used for storing DSE Node logs

separate_commit_log_disk.title: Use a separate volume for commit log data?
separate_commit_log_disk.description: Check to specify whether to use a separate volume for commit log data

commit_log_disk_type.title: Persistent commit log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]
commit_log_disk_type.description: Specify Persistent commit log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]

commit_log_volume_profile.description: Volume profile to be used for storing DSE Node commit logs

separate_cdc_log_disk.title: Use a separate volume for CDC log data?
separate_cdc_log_disk.description: Check to specify whether to use a separate volume for CDC (Change Data Capture) log data

cdc_log_disk.title: Persistent CDC log volume size (MB)
cdc_log_disk.description: Persistent CDC (Change Data Capture) log volume size (MB)

cdc_log_disk_type.title: Persistent CDC log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]
cdc_log_disk_type.description: Specify Persistent CDC (Change Data Capture) log volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]

cdc_log_volume_profile.description: Volume profile to be used for storing DSE Node CDC (Change Data Capture) logs

solr_disk_type.title: Persistent DSE Search volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]
solr_disk_type.description: Specify Persistent DSE Search volume type [ROOT, MOUNT]

solr_volume_profile.description: Volume profile to be used for storing DSE Search data

native_ssl_port.title: Cassandra native client ssl port (if separate from native_port)
native_ssl_port.description: Cassandra native client ssl port (if separate from native_port)

internode_ssl_port.title: Cassandra SSL inter-node cluster communication port
internode_ssl_port.description: Cassandra SSL inter-node cluster communication port

nodetool_cpus.title: How many CPUs needed to execute nodetool command
nodetool_cpus.description: Specify number of CPUs needed to execute nodetool command

nodetool_mem.title: How much memory (MB) needed to execute nodetool command
nodetool_mem.description: Specify amount of memory (MB) needed to execute nodetool command

num_tokens.description: The number of tokens randomly assigned to node(s) in a cluster that use vnodes

allocate_tokens_for_local_replication_fa.description: Replication Factor of keyspaces in datacenter - triggers the recommended algorithmic allocation for the Replication Factor and num_tokens for this node

initial_token.description: The token to start the contiguous range. Set this property for single-node-per-token architecture, in which a node owns exactly one contiguous range in the ring space

hinted_handoff_enabled.description: If true, hinted handoff is enabled for the cluster

max_hint_window_in_ms.description: The maximum amount of time, in ms, that hints are generates hints for an unresponsive node

hinted_handoff_throttle_in_kb.description: The maximum throttle per delivery thread in kilobytes per second

max_hints_delivery_threads.description: The maximum number of delivery threads for hinted handoff

hints_flush_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds Cassandra waits before flushing hints from internal buffers to disk

max_hints_file_size_in_mb.description: The maximum size for a single hints file, in megabytes

hints_compression_class.description: The compressor for hint files. Supported compressors: LZ, Snappy, and Deflate

batchlog_replay_throttle_in_kb.description: The total throttle for log replay in Kpbs

batchlog_endpoint_strategy.description: Strategy to choose the batchlog storage endpoints [random_remote, dynamic_remote, dynamic]

authenticator.description: The authentication backend. It implements IAuthenticator, which is used to identify users

authorizer.description: The authorization backend. It implements IAuthenticator, which limits access and provides permissions

role_manager.description: Specify RoleManager class. Default: DseRoleManager that supports, LDAP, Kerberos and internal roles

system_keyspaces_filtering.description: Whether to enable system keyspace filtering so that users can access and view only schema information for rows in the system and system_schema keyspaces to which they have access

roles_validity_in_ms.description: Validity period for roles cache in milliseconds

roles_update_interval_in_ms.description: Refresh interval for roles cache. After this interval, cache entries become eligible for refresh

permissions_validity_in_ms.description: How long permissions in cache remain valid to manage performance impact of permissions queries

permissions_update_interval_in_ms.description: Sets refresh interval for the standard authentication cache and the row-level access control (RLAC) cache

partitioner.description: The partitioner used to distribute rows across the cluster. Murmur3Partitioner is the recommended setting. RandomPartitioner and ByteOrderedPartitioner are supported for legacy applications

cdc_enabled.description: Whether to enable change data capture (CDC) functionality on a per-node basis

disk_failure_policy.description: Sets how the database responds to disk failure. Recommend settings: stop or best_effort. All Valid values: die, stop_paranoid, stop, best_effort, ignore

commit_failure_policy.description: Policy for commit disk failures. All Valid values: die, stop_commit, stop, ignore

prepared_statements_cache_size_mb.description: Maximum size of the native protocol prepared statement cache. Change this value only if there are more prepared statements than fit in the cache

key_cache_save_period.description: The duration in seconds that keys are saved in cache. Saved caches greatly improve cold-start speeds and has relatively little effect on I/O

key_cache_keys_to_save.description: The number of keys from the key cache to save

row_cache_class_name.description: The classname of the row cache provider to use

row_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum size of the row cache in memory. Row cache can save more time than key_cache_size_in_mb, but is space-intensive because it contains the entire row. Use the row cache only for hot rows or static rows. 0 disables the row cache

row_cache_save_period.description: Duration in seconds that rows are saved in cache. 0 disables caching

row_cache_keys_to_save.description: The number of keys from the row cache to save

counter_cache_size_in_mb.description: Counter cache helps to reduce counter locks' contention for hot counter cells

counter_cache_save_period.description: The time, in seconds, after which the database saves the counter cache (keys only)

counter_cache_keys_to_save.description: Number of keys from the counter cache to save

commitlog_sync.description: Commit log synchronization method. All Valid values: periodic, group, batch

commitlog_sync_period_in_ms.description: The number of milliseconds between disk fsync calls

commitlog_batch_window_in_ms.description: The maximum length of time that queries may be batched together

commitlog_segment_size_in_mb.description: The size of each commit log segment in MB

commitlog_compression_class.description: The compressor to use if commit log is compressed. Class name can be LZ4Compressor, Snappy, or Deflate

concurrent_materialized_view_builders.description: Number of simultaneous materialized view builder tasks allowed to run concurrently

file_cache_size_in_mb.description: Maximum memory for buffer pooling and SSTable chunk cache

disk_optimization_strategy.description: The strategy for optimizing disk reads. Can be either ssd (solid state disks) or spinning (spinning disks)

memtable_space_in_mb.description: Total permitted memory to use for memtables

memtable_cleanup_threshold.description: Ratio used for automatic memtable flush

memtable_allocation_type.description: The type of allocations for the Cassandra memtable. heap_buffers keep all data on the JVM heap. offheap_buffers may reduce heap utilization for large string or binary values. offheap_objects may improve heap size for small integers or UUIDs as well. Both off heap options will increase read latency

commitlog_total_space_in_mb.description: Total space to use for commit logs on disk

memtable_flush_writers.description: The number of memtable flush writer threads per disk and the total number of memtables that can be flushed concurrently, generally a combination of computer and I/O bound

cdc_total_space_in_mb.description: Total space to use for change-data-capture (CDC) logs on disk

cdc_free_space_check_interval_ms.description: Interval between checks for new available space for CDC-tracked tables when the cdc_total_space_in_mb threshold is reached and the CDCCompactor is running behind or experiencing back pressure

index_summary_resize_interval_in_minutes.description: How frequently index summaries should be re-sampled in minutes. This is done periodically to redistribute memory from the fixed-size pool to SSTables proportional their recent read rates

trickle_fsync.description: When set to true, causes fsync to force the operating system to flush the dirty buffers at the set interval trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb

trickle_fsync_interval_in_kb.description: The size of the fsync in kilobytes

internode_authenticator.description: Internode authentication backend to enable secure connections from peer nodes

start_native_transport.description: Enables or disables the native transport server

native_transport_max_frame_size_in_mb.description: The maximum allowed size of a frame

native_transport_max_concurrent_connecti.description: The maximum number of concurrent client connections
The maximum number of concurrent client connections per source IP address

native_transport_address.description: The address or interface to bind the native transport server to

native_transport_keepalive.description: Whether to enable keepalive on native connections

internode_send_buff_size_in_bytes.description: The sending socket buffer size, in bytes, for inter-node calls

internode_recv_buff_size_in_bytes.description: The receiving socket buffer size in bytes for inter-node calls

snapshot_before_compaction.description: Enable to take a snapshot before each compaction.

auto_snapshot.description: Whether to enable snapshots of the data before truncating a keyspace or dropping a table

tombstone_warn_threshold.description: The database issues a warning if a query scans more than this number of tombstones

tombstone_failure_threshold.description: The database aborts a query if it scans more than this number of tombstones

column_index_size_in_kb.description: Granularity of the index of rows within a partition

column_index_cache_size_in_kb.description: Threshold for the total size of all index entries for a partition that the database stores in the partition key cache

batch_size_warn_threshold_in_kb.description: Threshold to log a warning message when any multiple-partition batch size exceeds this value in kilobytes

batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb.description: Threshold to fail and log WARN on any multiple-partition batch whose size exceeds this value

unlogged_batch_across_partitions_warn_th.description: Threshold to log a WARN message on any batches not of type LOGGED that span across more partitions than this limit

concurrent_compactors.description: The number of concurrent compaction processes allowed to run simultaneously on a node, not including validation compactions for anti-entropy repair

compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec.description: The MB per second to throttle compaction for the entire system

compaction_large_partition_warning_thres.description: The partition size threshold before logging a warning

sstable_preemptive_open_interval_in_mb.description: The size of the SSTables to trigger preemptive opens by compaction process

stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_.description: Throttle for the throughput of all outbound streaming file transfers on a node in megabits per second

inter_dc_stream_throughput_outbound_mega.description: Throttle for all streaming file transfers between datacenters, and for network stream traffic as configured with stream_throughput_outbound_megabits_per_sec

read_request_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long the coordinator waits for read operations to complete before timing it out

range_request_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long the coordinator waits for sequential or index scans to complete before timing it out

aggregated_request_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long the coordinator waits for sequential or index scans to complete

write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long the coordinator waits for write requests to complete with at least one node in the local datacenter

counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long the coordinator waits for counter writes to complete before timing it out

cas_contention_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long the coordinator continues to retry a CAS (compare and set) operation that contends with other proposals for the same row

truncate_request_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long the coordinator waits for a truncate (the removal of all data from a table) to complete before timing it out

request_timeout_in_ms.description: The default timeout value for other miscellaneous operations. Lowest acceptable value is 10 ms

cross_dc_rtt_in_ms.description: Duration for how much to increase the cross-datacenter timeout (write_request_timeout_in_ms + cross_dc_rtt_in_ms) for requests that involve only nodes in a remote datacenter

slow_query_log_timeout_in_ms.description: Duration for how long before a node logs slow queries. Select queries that exceed this value generate an aggregated log message to identify slow queries

cross_node_timeout.description: Enable operation timeout information exchange between nodes to accurately measure request timeouts

streaming_connections_per_host.description: Maximum number of connections per host for streaming

phi_convict_threshold.description: The sensitivity of the failure detector on an exponential scale. Generally, this setting does not need adjusting

endpoint_snitch.description: A class that implements the IEndpointSnitch interface. The database uses the snitch to locate nodes and route requests

dynamic_snitch_update_interval_in_ms.description: The time interval, in milliseconds, between the calculation of node scores

dynamic_snitch_reset_interval_in_ms.description: Time interval after which the database resets all node scores. This allows a bad node to recover

dynamic_snitch_badness_threshold.description: The performance threshold for dynamically routing client requests away from a poorly performing node

internode_compression.description: Controls whether traffic between nodes is compressed. Valid values: all , dc or none

tracetype_query_ttl.description: TTL for different trace types used during logging of the query process

tracetype_repair_ttl.description: TTL for different trace types used during logging of the repair process

gc_log_threshold_in_ms.description: The threshold for log messages at the INFO level. Adjust to minimize logging

gc_warn_threshold_in_ms.description: Threshold for GC pause. Any GC pause longer than this interval is logged at the WARN level

enable_user_defined_functions.description: Check to enable user defined functions (UDFs), code that is executed inside Cassandra daemons

enable_scripted_user_defined_functions.description: Check to enable the use of JavaScript language in UDFs. Scripted UDFs are less performant than UDFs and produce more garbage on the heap

enable_user_defined_functions_threads.description: Check to enable sandbox for asynchronous JavaScript UDF execution

user_defined_function_warn_micros.description: Threshold in microseconds (CPU time). When a UDF runs too long and this threshold is exceeded, a warning is logged and sent to the client

user_defined_function_fail_micros.description: Threshold in microseconds (CPU time). When a fatal UDF run-time situation is detected and this threshold is exceeded, the UDF is stopped

user_defined_function_warn_heap_mb.description: Threshold in MB for heap allocations. When this threshold is exceeded, a warning is logged and sent to the client

user_defined_function_fail_heap_mb.description: Threshold in MB for heap allocations. When this threshold is exceeded, the UDF is stopped

user_function_timeout_policy.description: Defines action when a scripted UDF exceeds user_defined_function_fail_micros threshold

max_value_size_in_mb.description: The maximum size of any value in SSTables. SSTables are marked as corrupted when the threshold is exceeded

otc_coalescing_strategy.description: Strategy to combine multiple network messages into a single packet for outbound TCP connections to nodes in the same data center

otc_coalescing_window_us.description: Duration for how many microseconds to wait for coalescing messages to nodes in the same datacenter

otc_coalescing_enough_coalesced_messages.description: The threshold for the number of messages to nodes in the same data center

seed_gossip_probability.description: The percentage of time that gossip messages are sent to a seed node during each round of gossip

back_pressure_enabled.description: Whether to enable for the coordinator to apply the specified back pressure strategy to each mutation that is sent to replicas

back_pressure_strategy_class_name.description: The default class_name uses the ratio between incoming mutation responses and outgoing mutation requests

back_pressure_strategy_high_ratio.description: When outgoing mutations are below this value, they are rate limited according to the incoming rate decreased by the factor

back_pressure_strategy_factor.description: When backpressure is below high ratio, outgoing mutations are rate limited according to the incoming rate decreased by the given factor; if above high ratio, the rate limiting is increased by the given factor(1-10)

back_pressure_strategy_flow.description: The flow speed to apply rate limiting

continuous_paging_max_concurrent_session.description: The maximum number of concurrent sessions. Additional sessions are rejected with an unavailable error

continuous_paging_max_session_pages.description: The maximum number of pages that can be buffered for each session

continuous_paging_max_page_size_mb.description: The maximum size of a page, in MB. If an individual CQL row is larger than this value, the page can be larger than this value

continuous_paging_max_local_query_time_m.description: The maximum time for a local continuous query to run. When this threshold is exceeded, the session is swapped out and rescheduled

continuous_paging_client_timeout_sec.description: Duration for how long the server will wait, in seconds, for clients to request more pages if the client is not reading and the server queue is full

continuous_paging_cancel_timeout_sec.description: Duration for how long to wait before checking if a paused session can be resumed

continuous_paging_paused_check_interval_.description: Duration for how long to wait, in milliseconds, before checking if a continuous paging sessions can be resumed, when that session is paused because of backpressure

nodesync_rate_in_kb.description: The maximum bytes per second for data validation on the local node

tpc_cores.description: Number of TPC event loops. If not set, the default is the number of cores (processors on the machine) minus one

tpc_io_cores.description: The number of tpc_cores to use for asynchronous disk reads

io_global_queue_depth.description: Global IO queue depth used for reads when AIO is enabled (the default for SSDs). The optimal queue depth as found with the fio tool for a given disk setup

performance_max_threads.description: Maximum number of background threads used by the performance service

performance_core_threads.description: Number of background threads used by the performance service

max_memory_to_lock_fraction.description: Specify a fraction of the system memory for DSE In-Memory

max_memory_to_lock_mb.description: A maximum amount of memory in megabytes (MB) to be locked

ttl_index_rebuild_options_fixed_rate_per.description: Time interval to check for expired data in seconds

ttl_index_rebuild_options_initial_delay.description: The number of seconds to delay the first TTL check to speed up start-up time

ttl_index_rebuild_options_max_docs_per_b.description: The maximum number of documents to check and delete per batch by the TTL rebuild thread

ttl_index_rebuild_options_thread_pool_si.description: The maximum number of cores that can execute TTL cleanup concurrently

solr_resource_upload_limit_mb.description: Option to disable or configure the maximum file size of the search index config or schema

shard_transport_options_netty_client_req.description: Timeout behavior during distributed queries. The internal timeout for all search queries to prevent long running queries

back_pressure_threshold_per_core.description: The maximum number of queued partitions during search index rebuilding and reindexing

flush_max_time_per_core.description: The maximum time, in minutes, to wait for the flushing of asynchronous index updates that occurs at DSE Search commit time or at flush time

load_max_time_per_core.description: The maximum time, in minutes, to wait for each DSE Search index to load on startup or create/reload operations

enable_index_disk_failure_policy.description: Check to enable applying the configured disk failure policy if IOExceptions occur during index update operations

solr_data_dir.description: Directory path to store DSE Search index data

solr_field_cache_enabled.description: Check to enable the DSE search field cache

cql_solr_query_row_timeout.description: The maximum time in milliseconds to wait for each row to be read from the database during CQL Solr queries

performance_max_threads.description: Maximum number of background threads used by the performance service

graph_events_ttl_seconds.description: The time to live for graph events in milliseconds

cql_slow_log_options_enabled.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) log entries for slow queries

cql_slow_log_options_threshold.description: The threshold for log entries of slow queries in milliseconds or as a percentile

cql_slow_log_options_minimum_samples.description: The initial number of queries before activating the percentile filter

cql_slow_log_options_ttl_seconds.description: Time, in milliseconds, to keep the slow query log entries

cql_slow_log_options_skip_writing_to_db.description: Whether to keep slow queries in-memory only and not write data to database

cql_slow_log_options_num_slowest_queries.description: The number of slow queries to keep in-memory

cql_system_info_options_enabled.description: Enable to collect system-wide performance information about a cluster

cql_system_info_options_refresh_rate_ms.description: The length of the sampling period in milliseconds; the frequency to update the statistics

resource_level_latency_tracking_options_.description: Enable to collect object I/O performance statistics
The length of the sampling period in milliseconds; the frequency to update the statistics

db_summary_stats_options_enabled.description: Enable to collect database summary performance information

db_summary_stats_options_refresh_rate_ms.description: The length of the sampling period in milliseconds; the frequency to update the statistics

cluster_summary_stats_options_enabled.description: Enable to collect statistics at a cluster-wide level

cluster_summary_stats_options_refresh_ra.description: The length of the sampling period in milliseconds; the frequency to update the statistics

spark_cluster_info_options_enabled.description: Enable to collect Spark performance statistics

spark_cluster_info_options_refresh_rate_.description: The length of the sampling period in milliseconds; the frequency to update the statistics

spark_application_info_options_enabled.description: Enables or disables collecting Spark application information

spark_application_info_options_refresh_r.description: The time in milliseconds in which the data will be collected and stored

spark_application_info_options_driver_si.description: Enables or disables collecting metrics from the Spark Driver

spark_application_info_options_driver_co.description: Enables or disables collecting Spark Cassandra Connector metrics

spark_application_info_options_driver_jv.description: Enables or disables collecting JVM heap and garbage collection metrics from the Spark Driver

spark_application_info_options_driver_st.description: Enables or disables collecting application state metrics

spark_application_info_options_executor_.description: Enables or disables collecting Spark executor metrics
Enables or disables collecting Spark Cassandra Connector metrics from the Spark executors
Enables or disables collecting JVM heap or garbage collection metrics from the Spark executors

histogram_data_options_enabled.description: Enable the collection of histogram metrics data using the DataStax Enterprise Performance Service

histogram_data_options_refresh_rate_ms.description: The length of the sampling period in milliseconds; the frequency to update the statistics

histogram_data_options_retention_count.description: Count to control the number of complete histograms kept in the tables at any one time

user_level_latency_tracking_options_enab.description: To enable collecting user activity diagnostics using the DSE Performance Service

user_level_latency_tracking_options_refr.description: The length of the sampling period in milliseconds; the frequency to update the statistics.

user_level_latency_tracking_options_top_.description: Change to limit the number of individual metrics

solr_slow_sub_query_log_options_enabled.description: Enable to identify slow search queries using the DataStax Enterprise Performance Service

solr_slow_sub_query_log_options_ttl_seco.description: Duration for how many seconds a record survives before it is expired from the performance object

solr_slow_sub_query_log_options_async_wr.description: The number of server threads dedicated to writing in the log

solr_slow_sub_query_log_options_threshol.description: Duration for the slow log, the level (in milliseconds) at which a sub-query slow enough to be reported

solr_update_handler_metrics_options_enab.description: Enables collection of handler statistics metrics

solr_update_handler_metrics_options_ttl_.description: Duration for how many seconds a record survives before it is expired from the performance object

solr_update_handler_metrics_options_refr.description: Period (in milliseconds) between sample recordings for periodically updating Solr update handler metrics statistics

solr_request_handler_metrics_options_ena.description: Enables to record core-specific direct and request update handler statistics over time

solr_request_handler_metrics_options_ttl.description: Duration for how many seconds a record survives before it is expired from the performance object

solr_request_handler_metrics_options_ref.description: Period (in milliseconds) between sample recordings for periodically updating Solr request handler metrics statistics

solr_index_stats_options_enabled.description: Enables object records search index statistics over time

solr_index_stats_options_ttl_seconds.description: Duration for how many seconds a record survives before it is expired from the performance object

solr_index_stats_options_refresh_rate_ms.description: Period (in milliseconds) between sample recordings for periodically updating Solr index metrics statistics

solr_cache_stats_options_enabled.description: Enables object records current and cumulative cache statistics

solr_cache_stats_options_ttl_seconds.description: Duration for how many seconds a record survives before it is expired from the performance object

solr_cache_stats_options_refresh_rate_ms.description: Period (in milliseconds) between sample recordings for periodically updating Solr cache metrics statistics

solr_latency_snapshot_options_enabled.description: Enables the performance service to create the required tables and schedules the job to periodically update the relevant snapshot from the specified data source

solr_latency_snapshot_options_ttl_second.description: Duration for how many seconds a record survives before it is expired from the performance object

solr_latency_snapshot_options_refresh_ra.description: Period (in milliseconds) between sample recordings for periodically updating Solr latency snapshot metrics statistics

node_health_options_refresh_rate_ms.description: Period (in milliseconds) between sample recordings for periodically updating Node Health metrics statistics

node_health_options_uptime_ramp_up_perio.description: Amount of continuous uptime required for the node's uptime score to advance the node health score from 0 to 1 (full health), assuming there are no recent dropped mutations

node_health_options_dropped_mutation_win.description: The historic time window over which the rate of dropped mutations affect the node health score

enable_health_based_routing.description: Health-based routing enables a trade-off between index consistency and query throughput

async_bootstrap_reindex.description: Configure whether to asynchronously reindex bootstrapped data for DSE Search service

lease_metrics_options_enabled.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) log entries related to lease holders

lease_metrics_options_ttl_seconds.description: Defines the time, in milliseconds, to persist the log of lease holder changes

config_encryption_active.description: Enables decryption of configuration property values using the specified config_encryption_key_name

spark_shared_secret_bit_length.description: The length of a shared secret used to authenticate Spark components and encrypt the connections between them

spark_security_enabled.description: Enables Spark security based on shared secret infrastructure

spark_security_encryption_enabled.description: Enables encryption between DSE Spark Master and Workers, and of communication channels, except the web UI

spark_daemon_readiness_assertion_interva.description: Time interval, in milliseconds, between subsequent retries by the Spark plugin for Spark Master and Worker readiness to start

spark_worker_log_dir.description: The Spark logging directory is the directory where the Spark components store individual log files

spark_master_log_dir.description: The Spark logging directory is the directory where the Spark components store individual log files

spark_local_dirs.description: The Spark local directory is the directory where the Spark's temporary components are stored

spark_worker_dir.description: The Spark worker directory is the directory where the Spark's working components are stored

alwayson_sql_log_dir.description: The AlwaysOn SQL Service logging directory is the directory where the AlwaysOn SQL service store log files

spark_executor_dirs.description: Spark Executor(RDD) directory is the directory where RDDs are placed when executors decide to spill them to disk

resource_manager_options_worker_options_.description: The number of total system cores available to Spark
The amount of total system memory available to Spark

resource_manager_options_workpools_name.description: The name of the resource manager work pool

resource_manager_options_workpools_cores.description: The number of system cores to use in this work pool expressed as either an absolute value or a decimal value

resource_manager_options_workpools_memor.description: The amount of memory to use in this work pool expressed as either an absolute value or a decimal value

alwayson_sql_options_enabled.description: Check to enable AlwaysOn SQL Service for this node

alwayson_sql_options_thrift_port.description: The Thrift port on which AlwaysOn SQL Service listens

alwayson_sql_options_webui_port.description: The port on which the AlwaysOn SQL Service web UI is available

alwayson_sql_options_reserve_port_wait_t.description: The wait time in milliseconds to reserve the thrift_port if it is not available

alwayson_sql_status_check_wait_time_ms.description: The time in milliseconds to wait for a health check status of the AlwaysOn SQL Service server

alwayson_sql_options_workpool.description: The work pool name used by AlwaysOn SQL Service

alwayson_sql_options_log_dsefs_dir.description: Location in DSEFS of the AlwaysOn SQL Service log files

alwayson_sql_options_auth_user.description: The role to use for internal communication by AlwaysOn SQL Service if authentication is enabled

alwayson_sql_options_runner_max_errors.description: The maximum number of errors that can occur during AlwaysOn SQL Service runner thread runs before stopping the service

audit_logging_options_enabled.description: Enable to configure database activity logging

audit_logging_options_logger.description: The logger to use for recording events

audit_logging_options_included_categorie.description: Comma separated list of event categories that are captured

audit_logging_options_excluded_categorie.description: Comma separated list of categories to ignore

audit_logging_options_included_keyspaces.description: Specify keyspace names in a comma separated list for which events are logged

audit_logging_options_excluded_keyspaces.description: Specify a comma separated list for all keyspaces not be listed for log events

audit_logging_options_included_roles.description: The roles for which events are logged

audit_logging_options_excluded_roles.description: The roles for which events are not logged

audit_logging_options_retention_time.description: The amount of time, in hours, audit events are retained by supporting loggers

audit_logging_options_cassandra_audit_wr.description: The mode in which Cassandra audit writer runs in
The maximum number of events the writer dequeues before writing them out to the table
The maximum amount of time in milliseconds before an event is removed from the queue by a writer before being written out
The size of the queue feeding the asynchronous audit log writer threads
The consistency level that is used to write audit events
The directory to store the log file that reports dropped events
The interval, in milliseconds, between changing nodes to spread audit log information across multiple nodes

internode_messaging_options_server_accep.description: The number of server acceptor threads

internode_messaging_options_server_worke.description: The number of server worker threads

internode_messaging_options_client_max_c.description: The maximum number of client connections

internode_messaging_options_client_worke.description: The number of client worker threads

internode_messaging_options_client_reque.description: Timeout for non-query search requests like core creation and distributed deletes

dsefs_data_disk_type.description: DSE FS persistent disk type [ROOT, MOUNT]

dsefs_volume_profile.description: Volume profile to be used for storing DSEFS data

dsefs_disk.description: DSE File System size in MB

authentication_options_default_scheme.description: Sets the first scheme to validate a user against when the driver does not request a specific scheme

authentication_options_other_schemes.description: List of schemes that are also checked if validation against the first scheme fails and no scheme was specified by the driver

authentication_options_scheme_permission.description: Whether roles need to have permission granted to them in order to use specific authentication schemes

authentication_options_plain_text_withou.description: Controls how the DseAuthenticator responds to plain text authentication requests over unencrypted client connections

authentication_options_transitional_mode.description: Whether to enable transitional mode for temporary use during authentication setup in an already established environment

role_management_options_mode.description: Configure the DSE Role Manager by uncommenting role_management_options and setting the mode

authorization_options_enabled.description: Enable to use the DSE Authorizer for role-based access control (RBAC)

authorization_options_transitional_mode.description: Allows the DSE Authorizer to operate in a temporary transitional mode during setup of authorization in a cluster

authorization_options_allow_row_level_se.description: Whether to enable row-level access control (RLAC) permissions

search_dn.description: Distinguished name (DN) of an account with read access to the user_search_base and group_search_base

search_password.description: The password of the search_dn account

use_ssl.description: Enable to use an SSL-encrypted connection

use_tls.description: Whether to enable TLS connections to the LDAP server

user_search_base.description: Distinguished name (DN) of the object to start the recursive search for user entries for authentication and role management memberof searches

user_search_filter.description: Attribute that identifies the user that the search filter uses for looking up user names

user_memberof_attribute.description: Attribute that contains a list of group names; role manager assigns DSE roles that exactly match any group name in the list

group_search_type.description: Required when managing roles with LDAP. Define how group membership is determined for a user

group_search_base.description: The unique distinguished name (DN) of the group record from which to start the group membership search on

group_search_filter.description: Set to any valid LDAP filter for group search

group_name_attribute.description: The attribute in the group record that contains the LDAP group name

connection_pool_max_active.description: The maximum number of active connections to the LDAP server

connection_pool_max_idle.description: The maximum number of idle connections in the pool awaiting requests

conf_driver_pwd_encryption_enabled.description: Set enabled:true on an edge node to collect data in the replication log. Default: false

security_base_path.description: The base path to prepend to paths in the Advanced Replication configuration locations, including locations to SSL keystore, SSL truststore, and so on

host.title: OpsCenter Host Name
host.description: Hostname of the opscenter instance to connect to

stomp_port.title: Stomp port
stomp_port.description: Port used for DSE agents to reach OpsCenter

agent_restart_delay_seconds.title: DataStax Agent restart delay in seconds
agent_restart_delay_seconds.description: DataStax Agent restart delay in seconds

poll_period.description: The length of time, specified in seconds, between attempts to poll metrics

disk_usage_update_period.description: The length of time, in seconds, to wait between attempts to poll the disk for usage

rollup_rate.description: Maximum number of metrics that can be saved to Cassandra over the [rollup_rate_unit] period of time

rollup_rate_unit.description: Unit of time for rollup_rate. Choose from microsecond, millisecond, second, minute, hour, day, or month
